data.quote: God bears with the wicked  but not forever.
data.author: Cervantes

data.quote: Weak men are apt to be cruel because they stick at nothing that may repair the ill effect of their mistakes.
data.author: George, Lord Halifax

data.quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: I must be cruel Only to be kind.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: We are oftener treacherous through weakness than through calculation.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: When we do evil  We and our victims Are equally bewildered.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: Half of the harm that is done in this world Is due to people who want to feel important. They don't mean to do harm - but the harm does not interest them.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: We all have flaws  and mine is being wicked.
data.author: James Thurber

data.quote: Why inflict pain on oneself  when so many others are ready to save us the trouble?
data.author: George W. Pacaud

data.quote: God bears with the wicked  but not forever.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: No man ever became very wicked all at once.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: The world loves a spice of wickedness.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Wickedness is weakness.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: The wicked flee when no man pursueth  but the righteous are bold as a lion.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: The sun also shines on the wicked.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: 'Cause I's wicked  - I is. I's mighty wicked  anyhow  I can't help it.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: Wives are young men's mistresses  companions for middle age  and old men's nurses.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: She is a winsome wee thing  She is a handsome wee thing  She is a bonny wee thing  This sweet wee wife o' mine.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Think you  if Laura had been Petrarch's wife  He would have written sonnets all his life?
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: In every mess I find a friend  In every port a wife.
data.author: Charles Dibdin

data.quote: An undutiful Daughter will prove an unmanageable Wife.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: He knows little who will tell his wife all he knows.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: A miss for pleasure  and a wife for breed.
data.author: John Gay

data.quote: Alas! another instance of the triumph of hope over experience.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: All other goods by fortune's hand are given: A wife is the peculiar gift of Heav'n.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: She looketh well to the ways of her household  and eateth not the bread of idleness.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: It is a woman's business to get married as soon as possible  and a man's to keep unmarried as long as he can.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: My dear  my better half.
data.author: Philip Sidney

data.quote: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them and know it  but do not dare confess it to themselves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Nothing and no one can destroy the Chinese people. They are relentless survivors.
data.author: Pearl Buck

data.quote: Nothing is easy to the unwilling.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: The greatest intellectual capacities are only found in connection with a vehement and passionate will.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: The spirit indeed is willing  but the flesh is weak.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one often comes from a strong will  and the other from a strong won't.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: This free-will business is a bit terrifying anyway. It's almost pleasanter to obey  and make the most of it.
data.author: Ugo Betti

data.quote: Fall seven times  stand up eight.
data.author: Japanese proverb

data.quote: Where the willingness is great  the difficulties cannot be great.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: The will is the strong blind man who carries on his shoulders the lame man who can see.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Obstinacy is the result of the will forcing itself into the place of the intellect.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Make voyages. Attempt them. There's nothing else.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: Our strength is often composed of the weakness that we're damned if we are going to show.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: Nothing in the world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not  nothing is more common than unsuccessful men of talent. Genius will not  unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not  the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work. I have had many periods of wretchedness  but with energy and above all with illusions  I pulled through them all.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Man is both determined and self-determining.
data.author: Stein and Vidichon

data.quote: Don't let your will roar when your power only whispers.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Those who live are those who fight.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: If you start to take Vienna - take Vienna.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: If you would convince others  seem open to conviction yourself.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: You have to pay the price - but if you do you can only win.
data.author: Frank Leahy

data.quote: Victory - a matter of staying power.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: In war  as in life  it is often necessary  when some cherished scheme has failed  to take up the best alternative open  and if so  it is folly not to work for it with all your might.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: It isn't the mountain ahead that wears you out - it's the grain of sand in your shoe.
data.author: Robert Service

data.quote: Where there's a will there's a way.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: There is nothing good or evil save in the will.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: He who is firm in will molds the world to himself.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Not my will  but thine  be done.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: An ill wind that bloweth no man good -  The blower of which blast is she.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: Who walketh upon the wings of the wind.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Blow  wind  and crack your cheeks. Rage! Blow!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Sweet and low  sweet and low  Wind of the western sea  Low  low  breathe and blow  Wind of the western sea!
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Few things surpass old wine  and they may preach Who please  the more because they preach in vain  -  Let us have wine and women  mirth and laughter  Sermons and soda-water the day after.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: No nation is drunken where wine is cheap  and none sober where the dearness of wine substitutes ardent spirits as the common beverage. It is  in truth  the only antidote to the bane of whiskey.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Claret is the liquor for boys  port for men  but he who aspires to be a hero must drink brandy.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: There is a devil in every berry of the grape.
data.author: Koran

data.quote: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red  when it giveth his colour in the cup ... at the last it biteth like a serpent  and stingeth like an adder.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: Wine that maketh glad the heart of man.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Drink no longer water  but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Oh  the long and dreary Winter! Oh  the cold and cruel Winter!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: If Winter comes  can Spring be far behind?
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: A man's ruin lies in his tongue.
data.author: Egyptian saying

data.quote: A sage has one advantage  he is immortal. If this is not his century  many others will be.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: A wise man always throws himself on the side of his assailants. It is more his interests than it is theirs to find his weak point.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A wise man  to accomplish his end  may even carry his foe on his shoulder.
data.author: Panchatantra

data.quote: Ah  men do not know how much strength is in poise  That he goes the farthest who goes far enough.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: It wasn't raining when Noah built the ark.
data.author: Howard Ruff

data.quote: Knowledge can be communicated but not wisdom.
data.author: Hermann Hesse

data.quote: Le raison avant la passion - Reason over passion.
data.author: Pierre Elliott Trudeau

data.quote: Let my heart be wise. It is the gods' best gift.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Never since the time of Copernicus have so many experts been so wrong so often with so little humility.

data.quote: Night is the mother of counsels.

data.quote: Some folks are wise and some are otherwise.
data.author: Tobias Smollett

data.quote: The more specific you are  the more general it'll be.
data.author: Diane Arbus

data.quote: The number of people who will not go to a show they do not want to see is unlimited.
data.author: Oscar Hammerstein

data.quote: The question of commonsense is always "what is it good for?" - a question which would abolish the rose and be answered triumphantly by the cabbage.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: There was only one catch and that was Catch-22  which specified the concern for one's own safety in the face of dangers that were real and immediate was the process of a rational mind.
data.author: Joseph Heller

data.quote: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
data.author: Phaedrus

data.quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: The road to wisdom? Well  it's plain And simple to express: Err And err And err again But less And less And less.
data.author: Piet Hein

data.quote: A wise man hears one word and understands two.

data.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.

data.quote: Through wisdom a house is built and through understanding it is established.

data.quote: Great men are not always wise.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.

data.quote: Who is wise? He that learns from everyone. Who is powerful? He that governs his passions. Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.

data.quote: Not to know certain things is a great part of wisdom.
data.author: Hugo Grotius

data.quote: It is characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: A word to the wise is infuriating.

data.quote: The wise only possess ideas  the greater part of mankind are possessed by them.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: Learning passes for wisdom among those who want both.
data.author: William Temple

data.quote: It is not wise to be wiser than is necessary.
data.author: Philippe Quinault

data.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day  wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: A wise man sees as much as he ought  not as much as he can.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: A proverb is one man's wit and all men's wisdom.

data.quote: Almost every wise saying has an opposite one  no less wise  to balance it.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: We should be careful to get out of an experience only the wisdom that is in it - and stop there  lest we be like the cat that sits down on a hot stovelid. She will never sit down on a hot stove-lid again - and that is well  but also she will never sit down on a cold one anymore.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words - wait and hope.
data.author: Alexandre Dumas

data.quote: It's taken me all my life to understand that it is not necessary to understand everything.
data.author: Rent Coty

data.quote: What a man knows at fifty that he did not know at twenty is for the most part incommunicable.

data.quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom consists in being wise in time.

data.quote: Deliberate often - decide once.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: Nothing contributes so much to tranquilize the mind as a steady purpose - a point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye.
data.author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

data.quote: Knowledge comes  but wisdom lingers.

data.quote: In much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.

data.quote: The wise have a solid sense of silence and the ability to keep a storehouse of secrets. Their capacity and character are respected.

data.quote: My father used to say: Son  if you are not bright  you've got to be methodical  (defusing argument when challenged and proved right)
data.author: Robert Sachs

data.quote: Everyone whose deeds are more than his wisdom  his wisdom endures. And everyone whose wisdom is more than his deeds  his wisdom does not endure.

data.quote: It is easy to be wise after the event.

data.quote: The heart is wiser than the intellect.

data.quote: Days should speak  and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

data.quote: In youth and beauty wisdom is but rare!

data.quote: The price of wisdom is above rubies.

data.quote: Great men are not always wise.

data.quote: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.

data.quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom consists in being wise in time.

data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: If a man could half his wishes he would double his Troubles.

data.quote: I wish I knew the good of wishing.

data.quote: As you cannot do what you wish  you should wish what you can do.

data.quote: The banalities of a great man pass for wit.
