data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: Feminism is the most revolutionary idea there has ever been. Equality for women demands a change in the human psyche  more profound than anything Marx dreamed of. It means valuing parenthood as much as we value banking.
data.author: Polly Toynbee

data.quote: From birth to 18 a girl needs good parents. From 18 to 35  she needs good looks. From 35 to 55  good personality. From 55 on  she needs good cash. I'm saving my money.
data.author: Sophie Tucker

data.quote: I've got a woman's ability to stick to a job and get on with it when everyone else walks off and leaves it.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: In the sex-war  thoughtlessness is a weapon of the male  vindictiveness of the female. Both are reciprocally generated  but a woman's desire for revenge outlasts all other emotion. Yet when every unkind word about women has been said  we have still to admit  with Byron  that they are nicer than men. They are more devoted  more unselfish and more emotionally sincere. When the long fuse of cruelty  deceit and revenge is set alight  it is male thoughtlessness which has fired it.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: No woman marries for money  they are all clever enough  before marrying a millionaire  to fall in love with him first.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: People call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat or a prostitute.
data.author: Rebecca West

data.quote: The battle for women's rights has been largely won.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: The great and almost only comfort about being a woman is that one can always pretend to be more stupid than one is and no one is surprised.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: The great question which I have not been able to answer  despite my 30 years of research into the feminine soul  is "what does a woman want"?
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: There is in every true woman's heart a spark of heavenly fire  which lies dormant in the broad daylight of prosperity  but which kindles up and beams and blazes in the dark hour of adversity.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: Time and trouble will tame an advanced young woman. But an advanced old woman is uncontrollable by any force.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: We don't love a woman for what she says  but we like what she says because we love her.
data.author: Andri Maurois

data.quote: What one beholds of a woman is the least part of her.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Where young boys plan for what they will achieve and attain  young girls plan for whom they will achieve and attain.
data.author: Charlotte Perkins

data.quote: Women can do everything  men can do the rest.
data.author: Russian proverb

data.quote: Have you any notion how many books are written about women in the course of one year? Have you any notion how many are written by men? Are you aware that you are  perhaps  the most discussed animal in the universe?
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: A woman is the only thing I am afraid of that I know will not hurt me.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Music and women I cannot but give way to  whatever my business is.
data.author: Samuel Pepys

data.quote: A woman never sees what we do for her  she only sees what we don't do.
data.author: Georges Courteline

data.quote: You have to go back to the Children's Crusade in 1212 AD to find as unfortunate and fatuous an attempt at manipulated hysteria as the Women's Liberation Movement.
data.author: Helen Lawrenson

data.quote: A woman is always buying something.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Educating a beautiful woman is like pouring honey into a fine Swiss watch: everything stops.
data.author: Kurt Vonnegut

data.quote: By nice women . . . you probably mean selfish women who have no more thought for the underprivileged  overworked women than a pussycat in a sunny window for the starving kitten in the street. Now in that sense I am not a nice woman  for I do care.
data.author: Nellie McClung

data.quote: A kiss can be a comma  a question mark or an exclamation point. That's a basic spelling that every woman should know.
data.author: Mistinguette

data.quote: A beautiful woman who is pleasing to men is good only for frightening fish when she falls into the water.
data.author: Zen proverb

data.quote: Whether women are better than men I cannot say - but I can say they are certainly no worse.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: Of my two 'handicaps'  being female put many more obstacles in my path than being black.
data.author: Shirley Chisholm

data.quote: The toughest thing about being a housewife is you have no place to stay home from.
data.author: Patricia C. Beudoin

data.quote: The economic dependence of women is perhaps the greatest injustice that has been done to us  and has worked the greatest injury to the race.
data.author: Nellie McClung

data.quote: Whatever women do they must do twice as well as men to be thought half as good. Luckily  this is not difficult.
data.author: Charlotte Whitton

data.quote: All women's dresses are merely variations on the eternal struggle between the admitted desire to dress and the unadmitted desire to undress.
data.author: Lin Yutang

data.quote: If you can make a woman laugh you can do anything with her.
data.author: Nicol Williamson

data.quote: Woman is at once apple and serpent.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: The more underdeveloped the country  the more overdeveloped the women.
data.author: J. K. Galbraith

data.quote: One is not born a woman - one becomes one.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: Nature says to a woman: 'Be beautiful if you can  wise if you want to  but be respected  that is essential.'
data.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

data.quote: A modest woman  dressed out in all her finery  is the most tremendous object of the whole creation.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: Why should human females become sterile in their forties  while female crocodiles continue to lay eggs into their third century?
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: You don't know a woman until you have had a letter from her.
data.author: Ada Levenson

data.quote: Housework is what woman does that nobody notices unless she hasn't done it.
data.author: Evan Esar

data.quote: The worst thing about work in the house or home is that whatever you do is destroyed  laid waste or eaten within twenty-four hours.
data.author: Lady Kasluck

data.quote: The woman who thinks she is intelligent demands equal rights with men. A woman who is intelligent does not.
data.author: Colette

data.quote: Most women still need a room of their own and the only way to find it may be outside their own home.
data.author: Germaine Greer

data.quote: Women are the true maintenance class. Society is built upon their acquiescence and upon their small and necessary labours.
data.author: Sally Kempton

data.quote: It is hard to fight an enemy who has outposts in your head.
data.author: Sally Kempton

data.quote: A woman past forty should make up her mind to be young - not her face.
data.author: Billie Burke

data.quote: There is nothing enduring in life for a woman except what she builds in a man's heart.
data.author: Judith Anderson

data.quote: I know the nature of women  When you want to  they don't want to  And when you don't want to  they desire exceedingly.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: Even the most respectable woman has a complete set of clothes in her wardrobe ready for a possible abduction.
data.author: Sacha Guitry

data.quote: My vigour  vitality and cheek repel me. I am the kind of woman I would run from.
data.author: Nancy Lady Astor

data.quote: I have met with women who I really think would like to be married to a poem  and to be given away by a novel.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: A beautiful woman should break her mirror early.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale her infinite variety  other women cloy the appetites they feed  but she makes hungry where most she satisfies.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I don't know of anything better than a woman if you want to spend money where it will show.
data.author: Kin Hubbard

data.quote: In our civilization men are afraid they will not be men enough  and women are afraid they might be considered only women.
data.author: Theodor Reik

data.quote: It takes all the fun out of a bracelet if you have to buy it yourself.
data.author: Peggy Joyce

data.quote: The cave-dweller's wife complained that he hadn't dragged her anywhere in months.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: There is but an hour a day between a good housewife and a bad one.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: If a woman likes another woman  she's cordial. If she doesn't like her  she's very cordial.
data.author: Irvin S. Cobb

data.quote: Next to the wound  what women make best is the bandage.
data.author: Barbey d'Aurevilly

data.quote: Social science affirms that a woman's place in society marks the level of civilization.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: Nobody objects to a woman being a good writer or sculptor or geneticist if at the same time she manages to be a good wife  good mother  good looking  good tempered  well groomed and unaggressive.
data.author: Leslie M. Mclntyre

data.quote: When thou goest to woman  take thy whip.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: It was a woman who drove me to drink - and  you know  I never even thanked her.
data.author: W. C. Fields

data.quote: Has a woman who knew that she was well dressed ever caught a cold?
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Each suburban housewife spends her time presiding over a power plant sufficient to have staffed the palace of a Roman emperor with a hundred slaves.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: Boys don't make passes at female smart-asses.
data.author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

data.quote: As a woman  to be competitive is to be passive.
data.author: Marianne Partridge

data.quote: Women are like elephants. They are interesting to look at  but I wouldn't like to own one.
data.author: W. C. Fields

data.quote: No woman can call herself free who does not own and control her body. No woman can call herself free until she can choose consciously whether she will or will not be a mother.
data.author: Margaret Sanger

data.quote: Women are most adorable when they are afraid  that's why they frighten so easily.
data.author: Ludwig Borne

data.quote: Can we today measure devotion to husband and children by our indifference to everything else?
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: Women are perfectly well aware that the more they seem to obey the more they rule.
data.author: Jules Michelet

data.quote: Some women blush when they are kissed  some call for the police  some swear  some bite. But the worst are those who laugh.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: What will not woman  gentle woman dare When strong affection stirs her spirit up?
data.author: Robert Southey

data.quote: Women keep a special corner of their hearts for sins they have never committed.
data.author: Cornelia Otis Skinner

data.quote: Nature is in earnest when she makes a woman.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: The only question left to be settled now is  are women persons?
data.author: Susan B. Anthony

data.quote: Women do not find it difficult nowadays to behave like men  but they often find it extremely difficult to behave like gentlemen.
data.author: Compton Mackenzie

data.quote: When a woman dressjBS up for an occasion  the man should become the black velvet pillow for the jewel.
data.author: John Weitz

data.quote: Woman's place is in the wrong.
data.author: James Thurber

data.quote: There are no ugly women  only lazy ones.
data.author: Helena Rubinstein

data.quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
data.author: Gloria Steinem

data.quote: I dress for women - and I undress for men.
data.author: Angle Dickinson

data.quote: She was not a woman likely to settle for equality when sex gave her an advantage.
data.author: Anthony Delano

data.quote: Whether they give or refuse  women are glad to have been asked.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: One can find women who have never had a love affair  but it is rare indeed to find any who have had only one.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: The mirror is the conscience of women  they never do a thing without first consulting it.
data.author: Morltz G. Saphlr

data.quote: Simpson succeeded in proving that there was no harm in giving anaesthetics to men  because God put Adam into a deep sleep when He extracted his rib. But male ecclesiastics remained unconvinced as regards the sufferings of women  at any rate in childbirth.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: The cleverest woman finds a need for foolish admirers.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Women who set a low value on themselves make life hard for all women.
data.author: Nellie McClung

data.quote: Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Women are the cowards they are because they have been semi-slaves for so long. The number of women prepared to stand up for what they really think  feel  experience  with a man they are in love with is still very small.
data.author: Doris Lessing

data.quote: Woman's normal occupations in general run counter to creative life  or contemplative life  or saintly life.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: Men know that women are an overmatch for them  and therefore they choose the weakest or the most ignorant. If they did not think so  they never could be afraid of women knowing as much as themselves.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: If woman had no existence save in the fiction written by men  one would imagine her a person of the utmost importance  very various  heroic and mean  splendid and sordid  infinitely beautiful and hideous in the extreme  as great as a man  some think even better.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: No man is as anti-feminist as a really feminine woman.
data.author: Frank O'Connor

data.quote: The ideal woman which is in every man's mind is evoked by a word or phrase or the shape of her wrist  her hand. The most beautiful description of a woman is by understatement. Remember  all Tolstoy ever said to describe Anna Karenina was that she was beautiful and could see in the dark like a cat. Every man has a different idea of what's beautiful  and it's best to take the gesture  the shadow of the branch  and let the mind create the tree.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: The study of women's intelligence and personality has had broadly the same history as the one we record for Negroes ... in drawing a parallel between the position of  and feeling toward  women and Negroes  we are uncovering a fundamental basis of our culture.
data.author: Gunnar Myrdal

data.quote: When Eleanor Roosevelt was asked if she had any regrets about her life she replied "Just one. I wish I had been prettier."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Oh  the shrewdness of their shrewdness when they're shrewd. And the rudeness of their rudeness when they're rude  But the shrewdness of their shrewdness and the rudeness of their rudeness  Are nothing to their goodness when they're good.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Women always have some mental reservation.
data.author: Louis Ferdinand Destouches

data.quote: You see  dear  it is not true that woman was made from man's rib  she was really made from his funny bone.
data.author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

data.quote: In her first passion woman loves her lover  In all the others  all she loves is love.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: A woman is like your shadow  follow her  she flies  fly from her  she follows.
data.author: Sebastien Chamfort

data.quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned  Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
data.author: William Congreve

data.quote: But what is woman? Only one of nature's agreeable blunders.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: Men say of women what pleases them! women do with men what pleases them.
data.author: De Segur

data.quote: Cbercbez lafemme. (Find the woman.)
data.author: Alexander Dumas

data.quote: There is no worse evil than a bad woman  and nothing has ever been produced better than a good one.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: The society of women is the foundation of good manners.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Most men who run down women are running down one woman only.
data.author: Remy de Gourmont

data.quote: Women forgive injuries  but never forget slights.
data.author: Thomas Haliburton

data.quote: The crown of creation.
data.author: Herdeb

data.quote: Man has his will  - but woman has her way.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: It is God who makes woman beautiful  it is the devil who makes her pretty.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: A woman's guess is much more accurate than a man's certainty.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: An' I learned about women from 'er.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: The colonel's lady and Judy O'Grady Are sisters under their skins.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: For the female of the species is more deadly than the male.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: A rag and a bone and a hank of hair.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: There are no ugly women  there are only women who do not know how to look pretty.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: Earth's noblest thing  a Woman perfected.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The great fault in women is to desire to be like men.
data.author: De Maistre

data.quote: Too fair to worship  too divine to love.
data.author: Henry Hart Milman

data.quote: Grace was in all her steps  heaven in her eye  In every gesture dignity and love.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Offend her  and she knows not to forgive  Oblige her  and she'll hate you while you live.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Woman's at best a contradiction still.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: O wild  dark flower of woman  Deep rose of my desire  An Eastern wizard made you Of earth and stars and fire.
data.author: C. G. D. Roberts

data.quote: It is easier for a woman to defend her virtue against men than her reputation against women.
data.author: Rochebrune

data.quote: Such  Polly  are your sex - part truth  part fiction  Some thought  much whim  and all contradiction.
data.author: Richard Savage

data.quote: Honor women! they entwine and weave heavenly roses in our earthly life.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: The weakness of their reasoning faculty also explains why women show more sympathy for the unfortunate than men ... and why  on the contrary  they are inferior to men as regards justice  and less honourable and conscientious.
data.author: Schopenhauer

data.quote: O Woman! in our hours of ease  Uncertain coy  and hard to please  And variable as the shade By the light quivering aspen made  When pain and anguish wring the brow  A ministering angel thou!
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale Her infinite variety.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Fraily  thy name is woman!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: In the beginning  said a Persian poet - Allah took a rose  a lily  a dove  a serpent  a little honey  a Dead Sea apple  and a handful of clay. When he looked at the amalgram -  it was a woman.
data.author: William Sharp

data.quote: The fickleness of the woman I love is only equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Woman's dearest delight is to wound Man's self-conceit  though Man's dearest delight is to gratify hers.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: A woman either loves or hates: she knows no medium.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: Regard the society of women as a necessary unpleasantness of social life  and avoid it as much as possible.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: There is no such thing as romance in our day  women have become too brilliant  nothing spoils a romance so much as a sense of humor in the woman.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: She was a Phantom of delight When first she gleamed upon my sight  A lovely Apparition  sent To be a moment's ornament.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Action springs not from thought  but from a readiness for responsibility.
data.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

data.quote: What you can do  or dream you can do  begin it  boldness has genius  power and magic in it.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: There are people who put their dreams in a little box and say  "Yes  I've got dreams  of course  I've got dreams." Then they put the box away and bring it out once in a while to look in it  and yep  they're still there. These are great dreams  but they never even get out of the box. It takes an uncommon amount of guts to put your dreams on the line  to hold them up and say  "How good or how bad am I?" That's where courage comes in.
data.author: Erma Bombeck

data.quote: The difference between getting somewhere and nowhere is the courage to make an early start.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: All glory comes from daring to begin.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: How many feasible projects have miscarried through despondency  and been strangled in their birth by a cowardly imagination?
data.author: Jeremy Collier

data.quote: More powerful than the will to win is the courage to begin.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
data.author: Alonzo Newton Benn

data.quote: There is no such thing as a long piece of work  except one that you dare not start.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: He who begun has half done. Dare to be wise  begin.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: When it comes to betting on yourself ... you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Imposing limitations on yourself is cowardly because it protects you from having to try  and perhaps failing.
data.author: Vladimir Zworykin

data.quote: All know the way  few actually walk it.
data.author: Bodhidharma

data.quote: The distance doesn't matter  only the first step is difficult.
data.author: Madame Marquise du Deffand

data.quote: Seize opportunity by the beard  for it is bald behind.
data.author: Bulgarian proverb

data.quote: Procrastination usually results in sorrowful regret. Today's duties put off until tomorrow give us a double burden to bear  the best way is to do them in their proper time.
data.author: Ida Scott Taylor

data.quote: If you dam a river it stagnates. Running water is beautiful water.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Never mistake motion for action.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: A person who has not done one half his day's work by ten o' clock  runs a chance of leaving the other half undone.
data.author: Emily Bronte

data.quote: There is clearly much left to be done  and whatever else we are going to do  we had better get on with it.
data.author: Rosalynn Carter

data.quote: Procrastination is the thief of time.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: Slaying the dragon of delay is no sport for the short-winded.
data.author: Sandra Day O'Connor

data.quote: If a man would move the world  he must first move himself.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Who hesitate and falter life away  and lose tomorrow the ground won today.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: Now or never was the time.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: Can anything be sadder than work unfinished? Yes  work never begun.
data.author: Christina Rossetti

data.quote: Fear not that thy life shall come to an end  but rather that it shall never have a beginning.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: Go ahead with your life  your plans.... Don't waste time by stopping before the interruptions have started.
data.author: Richard L. Evans

data.quote: A hard beginning makes a good ending.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: We may our ends by our beginnings know.
data.author: Sir John Denham

data.quote: The only joy in the world is to begin.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: A schoolboy's tale  the wonder of an hour!
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Wonder is the basis of worship.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Men love to wonder and that is the seed of our science.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: No wonder can last more than three days.
data.author: Italian proverb

data.quote: Come live in my heart and pay no rent.
data.author: Samuel Lover

data.quote: There is a tide in the affairs of women Which  taken at the flood  leads - God knows where.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: "Yes " I answered you last night  "No " this morning  sir  I say: Colors seen by candle-light Will not look the same by day.
data.author: E. B. Browning

data.quote: And let us mind  faint heart ne'er wan A lady fair.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Tis enough -  Who listens once will listen twice  Her heart be sure is not of ice  And one refusal no rebuff.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Never wedding  ever wooing  Still a lovelorn heart pursuing  Read you not the wrong you're doing In my cheek's pale hue? All my life with sorrow strewing  Wed or cease to woo.
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: If I am not worth the wooing  I surely am not worth the winning.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Thrice happy's the wooing that's not long a-doing  So much time is saved in the billing and cooing.
data.author: R. H. Barham

data.quote: Why don't you speak for yourself  John?
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Perhaps if you address the lady Most politely  most politely  Flatter and impress the lady Most politely  most politely  Humbly beg and humbly sue  She may deign to look on you.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: The time I've lost in wooing  In watching and pursuing The light that lies In woman's eyes  Has been my heart's undoing.
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: They dream in courtship  but in wedlock wake.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Sigh no more  ladies  sigh no more  Men were deceivers ever  One foot in sea and one on shore  To one thing constant never.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A fool there was and he made his prayer (Even as you and I!) To a rag and a bone and a hank of hair (We called her the woman who did not care) But the fool he called her his lady fair -  (Even as you or I!)
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: Men are April when they woo  December when they wed.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The way of an eagle in the air  the way of a serpent upon a rock  the way of a ship in the midst of the sea  and the way of a man with a maid.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: She's beautiful and therefore to be woo'd: She is a woman  therefore to be won.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: O gentle Romeo  If thou dost love  pronounce it faithfully. Or if thou think'st I am too quickly won  I'll frown and be perverse and say thee nay  So thou wilt woo: but else  not for the world.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Words of affection  howsoe'er expressed  The latest spoken still are deem'd the best.
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: A very great part of the mischiefs that vex this world arises from words.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Words writ in waters.
data.author: George Chapman

data.quote: Fair words butter no parsnips.
data.author: John Clarke

data.quote: Mum is the word.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Words that weep  and tears that speak.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: But words once spoke can never be recall'd.
data.author: Wentworth Dillon

data.quote: Our words have wings  but fly not where we would.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: How forcible are right words!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Words are feminine  deeds are masculine.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In the beginning was the Word  and the Word was with God  and the Word was God.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I am not yet so lost in lexicography  as to forget that words are the daughters of earth  and that things are the sons of heaven.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Words are the most powerful drug used by mankind.
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: We should have a great many fewer disputes in the world if words were taken for what they are  the signs of our ideas only  and not for things themselves.
data.author: John Locke

data.quote: Speaking words of endearment where words of comfort availed not.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Sticks and stones may break my bones  But words can never harm me.
data.author: Old English Rhyme

data.quote: Words will build no walls.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: A word spoken in good season  how good it is!
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter  but war was in his heart  his words were softer than oil  yet were they drawn swords.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: One of our defects as a nation is a tendency to use what have been called "weasel words." When a weasel sucks eggs the meat is sucked out of the egg. If you use a "weasel word" after another there is nothing left of the other.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: My word fly up  my thoughts remain below: Words without thoughts never to heaven go.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A word to the wise is sufficient.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: Man does not live by words alone  despite the fact that sometimes he has to eat them.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: But yesterday the word of Caesar might Have stood against the world  now lies he there  And none so poor to do him reverence.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Taffeta phrases  silken terms precise  Three-piled hyperboles  spruce affectation  Figures pedantical.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I sometimes hold it half a sin To put in words the grief I feel  For words  like Nature  half reveal And half conceal the Soul within.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: He utters empty words  he utters sound without mind.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: You (Pindar) who possessed the talent of speaking much without saying anything.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: For of all sad words of tongue or pen  The saddest are these: "It might have been!"
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: 'twas bryllig and the slithy toves Did gyre and gimble in the wabe  All mimsy were the borogoves  And the mome raths out grabe.
data.author: Lewis Carroll

data.quote: A word is not the same with one writer as with another. One tears it from his guts. The other pulls it out of his overcoat pocket.
data.author: Charles Peguy

data.quote: Language is the Rubicon that divides man from beast.
data.author: Max Miiller

data.quote: Dialect words - those terrible marks of the beast to the truly genteel.
data.author: Thomas Hardy

data.quote: Eloquence is the language of nature  and cannot be learned in the schools  but rhetoric is the creature of art  which he who feels least will most excel in.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: For words  like Nature  half reveal And half conceal the Soul within.
data.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

data.quote: He multiplieth words without knowledge.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: If you were to make little fishes talk  they would talk like whales.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: In the beginning was the Word and the Word was with God  and the Word was God.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Languages are the pedigree of nations.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Let thy speech be short  comprehending much in few words.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Letter-writing is the only device for combining solitude with good company.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Man is a creature who lives not upon bread alone  but principally by catch words.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Many terms which have now dropped out of favour will be revived  and those that are at present respectable  will drop out  if useage so choose with whom resides the decision and the judgment and the code of speech.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Numbers constitute the only universal language.
data.author: Nathanael West

data.quote: Soft words are hard arguments.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Thanks to words  we have been able to rise above the brutes  and thanks to words  we have often sunk to the level of the demons.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: The adjective is the banana peel of the parts of speech.
data.author: Clifton Fadiman

data.quote: The limits of my language are the limits of my mind. All I know is what I have words for.
data.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

data.quote: The art of translation lies less in knowing the other language than in knowing your own.
data.author: Ned Rorem

data.quote: The two most beautiful words in the English language are "cheque enclosed".
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: The medium is the message.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: The stroke of the whip maketh marks in the flesh  but the stroke of the tongue breaketh the bones. Many have fallen by the edge of the sword  but not so many as have fallen by the tongue.
data.author: Ecclesiasticus

data.quote: The thoughtless are rarely wordless.
data.author: Howard W. Newton

data.quote: We must have a better word than "prefabricated"  why not "ready-made"?
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: We must think things not words  or at least we must constantly translate our words into the facts for which they stand  if we are to keep to the real and the true.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Words are the small change of thought.
data.author: Jules Renard

data.quote: Words should be weighed and not counted.
data.author: Yiddish proverb

data.quote: Since the concepts people live by are derived only from perceptions and from language and since the perceptions are received and interpreted only in light of earlier concepts  man comes pretty close to living in a house that language built.
data.author: Russell R. W. Smith

data.quote: If a conceptual distinction is to be made  the machinery for making it ought to show itself in language. If a distinction cannot be made in language  it cannot be made conceptually.
data.author: N. R. Hanson

data.quote: Often I am struck in amazement about a word: I suddenly realize that the complete arbitrariness of our language is but a part of the arbitrariness of our own world in general.
data.author: Christian Morgenstern

data.quote: Understanding is nothing else than conception caused by speech.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: Language is to the mind more than light is to the eye.
data.author: William Gibson

data.quote: Who does not know another language  does not know his own.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: To me  the term 'middle-class' connotes a safe  comfortable  middle-of-the road policy. Above all  our language is 'middle-class' in the middle of our road. To drive it to one side or the other or even off the road  is the noblest task of the future.
data.author: Christian Morgenstern

data.quote: Similes are like songs of love: They much describe  they nothing prove.
data.author: Matthew Prior

data.quote: Words are the physicians of a mind diseased.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: A language is a dialect with its own army and navy.
data.author: Max Weinreich

data.quote: 'When I use a word ' Humpty Dumpty said in rather a scornful tone  'it means just what I choose it to mean - neither more nor less.' 'The question is ' said Alice  'whether you can make words mean so many different things.' 'The question is ' said Humpty Dumpty  'which is to be master - that's all.'
data.author: Lewis Carroll

data.quote: The word is half his that speaks  and half his that hears it.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: A single word often betrays a great design.
data.author: Jean Baptiste Racine

data.quote: Words once spoken  can never be recalled.
data.author: Wentworth Dillon

data.quote: Some words are like the old Roman galleys  large-scaled and ponderous. They sit low in the water even when their cargo is light.
data.author: William Jovanovich

data.quote: It's as interesting and as difficult to say a thing well as to paint it. There is the art of lines and colours  but the art of words exists too  and will never be less important.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and the lightning bug.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Words  like eyeglasses  blur everything that they do not make clear.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: There is only one way to degrade mankind permanently and that is to destroy language.
data.author: Northrop Frye

data.quote: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.
data.author: David Hare

data.quote: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
data.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

data.quote: More than kisses  letters mingle souls.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: I wonder what language truck drivers are using  now that everyone is using theirs?
data.author: Beryl Pfizer

data.quote: The two words 'information' and 'communication' are often used interchangeably  but they signify quite different things. Information is giving out  communication is getting through.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: England and America are two countries separated by the same language.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The Englishman loves to roll his tongue around the word  'extraordinary'. It so pleases him that he is reluctant to finish the sound which goes on into harmonics and overtones. The North American publisher is likewise inclined.
data.author: R. I. Fitzhenry

data.quote: Words are feminine  deeds are masculine.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Let it not be said that I have said nothing new. The arrangement of the material is new.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: When an idea is wanting  a word can always be found to take its place.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Speech is civilization itself. The word  even the most contradictory word  preserves contact - it is silence which isolates.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: In certain trying circumstances  urgent circumstances  desperate circumstances  profanity furnishes a relief denied even to prayer.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Like stones  words are laborious and unforgiving  and the fitting of them together  like the fitting of stones  demands great patience and strength of purpose and particular skill.
data.author: Edmund Morrison

data.quote: Great literature is simply language charged with meaning to the utmost possible degree.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: One way of looking at speech is to say it is a constant stratagem to cover nakedness.
data.author: Harold Pinter

data.quote: The downtrodden  who are the great creators of slang  hurl pithiness and colour at poverty and oppression.
data.author: Anthony Burgess

data.quote: Slang is language which takes off its coat  spits on its hands - and goes to work.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Man's command of the language is most important. Next to kissing  it's the most exciting form of communication.
data.author: Oren Arnold

data.quote: "Plain English" - everybody loves it  demands it - from the other fellow.
data.author: Jacques Barzun

data.quote: Words are as recalcitrant as circus animals  and the unskilled trainer can crack his whip at them in vain.
data.author: Gerald Brenan

data.quote: The magic of the tongue is the most dangerous of all spells.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: You have to fall in love with hanging around words.
data.author: John Ciardi

data.quote: Language is the armoury of the human mind  and at once contains the trophies of its past  and the weapons of its future conquests.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: Everyone hears only what he understands.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: When I feel inclined to read poetry  I take down my dictionary. The poetry of words is quite as beautiful as the poetry of sentences.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Language most shows a man  speak that I may see thee.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: True eloquence consists of saying all that should be  not all that could be  said.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Even if language is a living evolving organism  we don't have to embrace all the changes that occur during our lifetimes. If language is so alive  it can get sick.
data.author: Christopher Lehmann-Haupt

data.quote: Our language  one of our most precious natural resources  deserves at least as much protection as our woodlands  streams and whooping cranes.
data.author: James Lipton

data.quote: His words were softer than oil  yet they were drawn swords.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Language is an inventory of human experience.
data.author: L. W. Lockhart

data.quote: Change is legitimate and inevitable  for our language is a mighty river  picking up silt and flotsam here and discarding it there  but growing ever wider and richer.
data.author: Robert MacNeil

data.quote: The grossest thing in our gross national product today is our language. It is suffering from inflation.
data.author: James Reston

data.quote: A word has its use  Or  like a man  it will soon have a grave.
data.author: Edward Arlington Robinson

data.quote: No matter how eloquently a dog may bark  he cannot tell you that his parents were poor but honest.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Most people have to talk so they won't hear.
data.author: May Sarton

data.quote: Every utterance is an event  and no two events are precisely alike. The extreme view  therefore  is that no word ever means the same thing twice.
data.author: Louis B. Saloman

data.quote: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed  the deeper they burn.
data.author: Robert Southey

data.quote: If you can teach me a new word  I'll walk all the way to China to get it.
data.author: Turkish proverb

data.quote: I have always suspected that correctness is the last refuge of those who have nothing to say.
data.author: Friedrich Wasiman

data.quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be a boss and work 12 hours a day.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Everything considered  work is less boring than amusing oneself.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: A windmill is eternally at work to accomplish one end  although it shifts with every variation of the weather cock  and assumes 10 different positions in a day.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: A good horse should be seldom spurred.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: All work is seed sown. It grows and spreads  and sows itself anew.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
data.author: Fairlane

data.quote: Give the labourer his wage before his perspiration be dry.
data.author: Muhammad

data.quote: I want a house that has gotten over all its troubles  I don't want to spend the rest of my life bringing up a young and inexperienced house.
data.author: Jerome K. Jerome

data.quote: If you want a work well done  select a busy man: the other kind has no time.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: It is impossible to enjoy idling thoroughly unless one has plenty of work to do.
data.author: Jerome K. Jerome

data.quote: Most people work the greater part of their time for a mere living  and the little freedom which remains to them so troubles them that they use every means of getting rid of it.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Neither snow  nor rain  nor heat  nor gloom of night stay these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.
data.author: Herodotus

data.quote: No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: No task  rightly done is truly private. It is part of the world's work.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: One machine can do the work of 50 ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: One of the saddest things is  the only thing a man can do for 8 hours a day  day after day  is work. You can't eat 8 hours a day nor drink for 8 hours a day  nor make love for 8 hours.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: The only place where success comes before work is a dictionary.
data.author: Vidal Sassoon

data.quote: Routine is the god of every social system  it is the seventh heaven of business  the essential component in the success of every factory  the ideal of every statesman.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: The monarchy is a labour-intensive industry.
data.author: Harold Wilson

data.quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: They say hard work never hurt anybody  but I figure why take the chance.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: Unionism  seldom if ever  uses such powers as it has to ensure better work  almost always it devotes a large part of that power to safeguarding bad work.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Work is of two kinds: first  altering a position of matter at or near the earth's surface relatively to other such matter  second  telling other people to do so. The first kind is unpleasant and ill-paid  the second is pleasant and highly paid.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: As a remedy against all ills - poverty  sickness  and melanchol - only one thing is absolutely necessary: a liking for work.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: They intoxicate themselves with work so they won't see how they really are.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Most people like hard work  particularly when they're paying for it.
data.author: Franklin P. Jones

data.quote: We work to become  not to acquire.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: If one defines the term 'dropout' to mean a person who has given up serious effort to meet his responsibilities  then every business office  government agency  golf club and university faculty would yield its quota.
data.author: John W. Gardner

data.quote: Hasten slowly  and without losing heart  put your work twenty times upon the anvil.
data.author: Nicolas Boileau

data.quote: How many years of fatigue and punishment it takes to learn the simple truth that work  that disagreeable thing  is the only way of not suffering in life  or at all events  of suffering less.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Miracles sometimes occur  but one has to work terribly hard for them.
data.author: Chaim Weizmann

data.quote: Beware all enterprises that require new clothes.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Employment is nature's physician  and is essential to human happiness.
data.author: Galen

data.quote: Work is the grand cure of all the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not. The cure for it is occupation.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Chance favours only those who know how to court her.
data.author: Charles Nicolle

data.quote: Work is man's most natural form of relaxation.
data.author: Dagobert Runes

data.quote: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength  his glory and his pleasure.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: If a man loves the labour of his trade  apart from any question of success or fame  the gods have called him.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: When white-collar people get jobs  they sell not only their time and energy  but their personalities as well. They sell by week  or month  their smiles and their kindly gestures  and they must practise prompt repression of resentment and aggression.
data.author: C. Wright Mills

data.quote: He that can work is a born king of something.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Love of bustle is not industry.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: The joy about our work is spoiled when we perform it not because of what we produce but because of the pleasure with which it can provide us  or the pain against which it can protect us.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: Productive work is the central purpose of a rational man's life  the central value that integrates and determines the hierarchy of all his other values. Reason is the source  the precondition of his productive work - pride is the result.
data.author: Ayn Rand

data.quote: By the work one knows the workman.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Because it is less structured than work  leisure time leaves workaholics at a loss for what to do. Workaholics practically climb the wall when they can't work.
data.author: Marilyn Machlowitz

data.quote: Workaholics commit slow suicide by refusing to allow the child inside them to play.
data.author: Dr. Laurence Susser

data.quote: Man works primarily for his own self-respect and not for others or for profit. . . the person who is working for the sake of his own satisfaction  the money he gets in return serves merely as fuel  that is  as a symbol of reward and recognition  in the last analysis  of acceptance by one's fellowmen.
data.author: Otto Rank

data.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive  and the true success is to labour.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: In a professional once engaged  the performance of the job comes first.
data.author: Garson Kanin

data.quote: If a little labour  little are our gains. Man's fortunes are according to his pains.
data.author: Robert Herrick

data.quote: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A man must love a thing very much if he not only practises it without any hope of fame and money  but even practises it without any hope of doing it well.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: A hobby is hard work you wouldn't do for a living.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A task becomes a duty from the moment you suspect it to be an essential part of that integrity which alone entitles a man to assume responsibility.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: God gave man work  not to burden him  but to bless him  and useful work  willingly  cheerfully  effectively done  has always been the finest expression of the human spirit.
data.author: Walter R. Courtenay

data.quote: Work is more fun than fun.
data.author: Noel Coward

data.quote: When more and more people are thrown out of work  unemployment results.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: Man's usual routine is to work and to dream and work and dream.
data.author: Raymond Queneau

data.quote: We can redeem anyone who strives unceasingly.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: The Gods rank work above virtues.
data.author: Hesiod

data.quote: Anyone can do any amount of work provided it isn't the work he is supposed to be doing at that moment.
data.author: Robert Benchley

data.quote: It is not upon thee to finish the work  neither art thou free to abstain from it.
data.author: The Talmud

data.quote: Work banishes those three great evils  boredom  vice  and poverty.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Amateurs hope. Professionals work.
data.author: Garson Kanin

data.quote: Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste  it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: There is dignity in work only when it is work freely accepted.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: If a man will not work  he shall not eat.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Anyone who is honestly seeking a job and can't find it  deserves the attention of the United States government  and the people.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Work is the inevitable condition of human life  the true source of human welfare.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: He who shuns the millstone  shuns the meal.
data.author: Erasmus

data.quote: Rest is the sweet sauce of labour.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: God gives every bird its food  but he does not throw it into the nest.
data.author: J. G. Holland

data.quote: When your work speaks for itself  don't interrupt.
data.author: Henry J. Kaiser

data.quote: I work as my father drank.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: While I am busy with little things  I am not required to do greater things.
data.author: St. Francis de Sales

data.quote: For it is commonly said: accomplished labours are pleasant.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: A people so primitive that they did not know how to get money except by working for it.
data.author: George Ade

data.quote: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
data.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

data.quote: If all the year were playing holidays To sport would be as tedious as to work.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I am only an average man  but  by George  I work harder at it than the average man.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: Work is accomplished by those employees who have not yet reached their level of incompetence.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: When I was a young man I observed that nine out of ten things I did were failures. I didn't want to be a failure  so I did ten times more work.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The worst crime against working people is a company which fails to operate at a profit.
data.author: Samuel Gompers

data.quote: How do I work? I grope.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: It is the privilege of any human work which is well done to invest the doer with a certain haughtiness. He can well afford not to conciliate  whose faithful work will answer for him.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Work and love - these are the basics. Without them there is neurosis.
data.author: Theodor Reik

data.quote: The effectiveness of work increases according to geometric progression if there are no interruptions.
data.author: Andri Maurois

data.quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well  and when you find it  put your whole soul into it-every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
data.author: John D. Rockefeller III

data.quote: Every woman is a human being-one cannot repeat that too often-and a human being must have occupation if he or she is not to become a nuisance to the world.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: The happy people are those who are producing something.
data.author: William Ralph Inge

data.quote: Congenial labor is essence of happiness.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: Work is a substitute "religious" experience for many workaholics.
data.author: Mary Daly

data.quote: When I can no longer create anything  I'll be done for.
data.author: Coco Chanel

data.quote: Employment is nature's physician  and is essential to human happiness.
data.author: Galen

data.quote: No thoroughly occupied man was ever yet very miserable.
data.author: Letitia Landon

data.quote: When I stop [working]  the rest of the day is posthumous. I'm only really alive when I'm working.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Continuity of purpose is one of the most essential ingredients of happiness in the long run  and for most men this comes chiefly through their work.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive. It is like having sex.
data.author: Federico Fellini

data.quote: After fifty years of living  it occurs to me that the most significant thing that people do is go to work  whether it is to go to work on their novel or at the assembly plant or fixing somebody's teeth.
data.author: Thomas McGuane

data.quote: He who labors diligently need never despair  for all things are accomplished by diligence and labor.
data.author: Menander

data.quote: The fun of being alive is realizing that you have a talent and you can use it every day  so it grows stronger. ... And if you're in an atmosphere where this talent is appreciated instead of just tolerated  why  it's just as good as sex.
data.author: Lou Centlivre

data.quote: Work! Thank God for the swing of it  for the clamoring  hammering ring of it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There are certain natures to whom work is nothing  the act of work everything.
data.author: Arthur Symons

data.quote: I am fierce for work. Without work I am nothing.
data.author: Winifred Holtby

data.quote: Like plowing  housework makes the ground ready for the germination of family life. The kids will not invite a teacher home if beer cans litter the living room. The family isn't likely to have breakfast together if somebody didn't remember to buy eggs  milk  or muffins. Housework maintains an orderly setting in which family life can flourish.
data.author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

data.quote: When I die  my epitaph should read: She Paid the Bills.
data.author: Gloria Swanson

data.quote: There's no labor a man can do that's undignified  if he does it right.
data.author: Bill Cosby

data.quote: Never turn down a job because you think it's too small  you never know where it may lead.
data.author: Julia Morgan

data.quote: If a man is called to be a streetsweep-er  he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted  or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say  here lived a great streetsweeper who did his job well.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Don't be afraid of hard work.
data.author: Marian Wright Edelman

data.quote: The work praises the man.
data.author: Irish proverb

data.quote: Originality and the feeling of one's own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

data.quote: There is a kind of victory in good work  no matter how humble.
data.author: Jack Kemp

data.quote: Labor disgraces no man  unfortunately  you occasionally find men who disgrace labor.
data.author: Ulysses S. Grant

data.quote: Honest labor bears a lovely face.
data.author: Thomas Dekker

data.quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: The world is moved not only by the mighty shoves of the heroes  but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: A professional is someone who can do his best work when he doesn't feel like it.
data.author: Alistair Cooke

data.quote: The highest reward for man's toil is not what he gets for it  but what he becomes by it.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
data.author: Greer Garson

data.quote: Ambition is destruction  only competence matters.
data.author: Jill Robinson

data.quote: I was brought up to believe that the only thing worth doing was to add to the sum of accurate information in the world.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: Never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Here I am  where I ought to be.
data.author: Louise Erdrich

data.quote: To find in ourselves what makes life worth living is risky business  for it means that once we know we must seek it. It also means that without it life will be valueless.
data.author: Marsha Sinetar

data.quote: Everybody undertakes what he sees another successful in  whether he has the aptitude for it or not.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: You have to do what you love to do  not get stuck in that comfort zone of a regular job. Life is not a dress rehearsal. This is it.
data.author: Lucinda Basset

data.quote: Men take only their needs into consideration  never their abilities.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: If you're in a good profession  it's hard to get bored  because you're never finished-there will always be work you haven't done.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: Work means so many things! So many! Among other things  work also means freedom. ... Without it even the miracle of love is only a cruel deception.
data.author: Eleonora Duse

data.quote: One should stick to the sort of thing for which one was made  I tried to be an herbalist  whereas I should keep to the butcher's trade.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: One's lifework  I have learned  grows with the working and the living. Do it as if your life depended on it  and first thing you know  you'll have made a life out of it. A good life  too.
data.author: Theresa Helburn

data.quote: One principal reason why men are so often useless is that they neglect their own profession or calling  and divide and shift their attention among a multitude of objects and pursuits.
data.author: Nathaniel Emmons

data.quote: Men whose trade is rat-catching love to catch rats  the bug destroyer seizes on his bug with delight  the suppressor is gratified by finding his vice.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Work is creativity accompanied by the comforting realization that one is bringing forth something really good and necessary  with a conviction that a sudden  arbitrary cessation would cause a sensitive void  produce a loss.
data.author: Jenny Heynrichs

data.quote: Some people are born to lift heavy weights  some are born to juggle golden balls.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself  you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around wondering about yourself.
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do  and to secure an opportunity to do it  is the key to happiness.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: The high prize of life  the crowning fortune of man  is to be born with a bias to some pursuit which finds him in employment and happiness.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: They are happy men whose natures sort with their vocations.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: I know a lot of people think it's monotonous  down the black lines over and over  but it's not if you're enjoying what you're doing. I love to swim and I love to train.
data.author: Tracy Caulkins

data.quote: Do your duty until it becomes your joy.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: Duty is an icy shadow. It will freeze you. It cannot fill the heart's sanctuary.
data.author: Augusta Evans

data.quote: What a richly colored strong warm coat is woven when love is the warp and work is the woof.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: Whenever it is possible  a boy should choose some occupation which he should do even if he did not need the money.
data.author: William Lyon Phelps

data.quote: Some people regard discipline as a chore. For me  it is a kind of order that sets me free to fly.
data.author: Julie Andrews

data.quote: Find something you're passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: There must be bands of enthusiasts for everything on earth-fanatics who shared a vocabulary  a batch of technical skills and equipment  and  perhaps  a vision of some single slice of the beauty and mystery of things  of their complexity  fascination  and unexpectedness.
data.author: Annie Dillard

data.quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I've ever known.
data.author: Walt Disney

data.quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Only he is successful in his business who makes that pursuit which affords him the highest pleasure sustain him.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Work is a world apart from jobs. Work is the way you occupy your mind and hand and eye and whole body when they're informed by your imagination.
data.author: Alice Koller

data.quote: I believe in my work and in the joy of it. You have to be with the work and the work has to be with you. It absorbs you totally and you absorb it totally.
data.author: Louise Nevelson

data.quote: Cooking is like love. It should be entered into with abandon or not at all.
data.author: Harriet Van Home

data.quote: Give me a man who sings at his work.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle
